intro: Tetrazygiopsis laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered tetrazygiopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, commonly known as the carrot or parsley family. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges. Tetrazygiopsis laxiflora is often found in sandy or loamy soils and is known for its delicate appearance and ecological significance in its native range.
